meanings.definition: To set a new price for something.
meanings.sent1: The store reprices its products every month.
meanings.sent2: She reprices the items in the clearance section.
meanings.sent3: The robot reprices the items with a laser beam.
meanings.sent4: The magician reprices the tickets with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent5: The computer program reprices the inventory automatically.

meanings.definition: To adjust the price of something.
meanings.sent1: He reprices the antique vase before putting it up for auction.
meanings.sent2: The company reprices its services to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The chef reprices the menu items for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent4: The artist reprices his paintings based on demand.
meanings.sent5: The manager reprices the products to match the competitor's prices.

meanings.definition: To change the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The online retailer reprices its products based on market trends.
meanings.sent2: She reprices the items in the store to boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer reprices the items for the bidding war.
meanings.sent4: The farmer reprices the crops after a successful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The real estate agent reprices the properties for the new listings.
